results.title: Montgomery Clift: the prince
results.creator_credit: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hollywood’s rebels”.
A documentary incorporating footage of Montgomery Clift’s most memorable films; interviews with family and with friends of Clift (including Jane Fonda); and rare archival material stretching back to his childhood. What develops is the story of an intense young boy who yearned for stardom, achieved notable success in such classic films as “From Here to Eternity” and “I Confess”, only to be ruined by alcohol addiction and his inability to face his own fears and homosexual desires. Montgomery Clift, as this video portrays him, may have not been a happy man but he never compromised his acting talents for Hollywood.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claudio Masenza, Donatella Baglivo and Ciak Studio

results.title: The Clown princes of Hollywood. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam, Sterling Educational Films and Gregstan Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Explains that some of the early comedians like Charlie Chaplin and Harold Lloyd became Hollywood royalty, while others who made audiences laugh but never reached the top of the ladder were dubbed “clown princes”. Uses original silent footage to examine the different styles and personalities of some of the comedians, including Charlie Chaplin, Harold Lloyd, Larry Seman, Charlie Chase, Laurel and Hardy, Ben Turpin and Billy West.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam, Sterling Educational Films and Gregstan Productions

results.title: The Son of the Sheik. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Presents an edited version of the 1926 production of “The Son of the Sheik”, a typical adventure of the golden age of the movies. Stars Rudolph Valentino. Narrated by Paul Killiam.

results.title: Western Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Experience the highlights of Western Australia beginning with the wildlife and good food at Margaret River, visit the Pinnacles, enjoy a range of sporting activities at Merribrook, join a cattle muster at El Questro or a novelty gypsy caravan tour, explore the Spanish architecture at New Norcia - the country town built to bring christianity to the Aborigines, visit the Pilbara and picturesque Broome or board a yacht to explore remote sections of Western Australia’s spectacular coastline.

results.title: The Black pirate. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited and narrated presentation of the duels, sea battles and acrobatics in the ‘Black Pirate’ an adventure film made in 1926 starring Douglas Fairbanks. Includes the famous sliding-down-the-sail stunt. Also stars Billie Dove.

results.title: New South Wales
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Enjoy the tranquil beauty of Myall Lakes, experience a journey on the Zig Zag railway aboard a steam locomotion, tour Fort Denison or take an alpine escape to the Snowy Mountains, view the spectacular rugged coastline at Murramarang, cruise Sydney Harbour on a replica of the ‘Bounty’, stargaze in the Warrumbungles, visit the Blue Mountains, sample the local product at the Pepper Tree vineyard in the Hunter Valley - the cradle of Australian wine making and complete your New South Wales tour with a 9 day marathon bike road tour.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.

results.title: The Thief of Baghdad. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
An edited version with commentary of the children’s silent classic adventure fantasy, “The Thief of Baghdad” made in 1924 and directed by Raoul Walsh. Features Douglas Fairbanks in the role of the thief.

results.title: Tasmania
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Holiday”.
Tasmania’s attractions highlighted in this video range from the picturesque landscapes of Cataract Gorge, Cradle Mountain and Flinders Island to relaxing sporting events such as fishing at London Lakes and viewing the Targa Road Race. Visit historical Port Arthur, Hawley House and the grave of Tom Roberts and indulge in a novelty stop-over at a reproduction Swiss Village.
